msDesc.head: Composite, various scholastic works; France (?) and Germany (?), 12th century and 13th century, early

physDesc.p: Composite: fols. 1–47 || fols. 48–138 || fols. 139–141 || fols. 142–181 || fols. 182–204 || fols. 205–256 (several sections) || fols. 257–312

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Abp. Laud, 1637–1639.

history.provenance: Eberbach, Cistercian abbey: the whole volume identifiable as g 8 in the library catalogue of 1502.
Eberbach ex libris with a monogram of J.W., 1583 (fol. 229r)
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639.

recordHist.source:
Description by Tuija Ainonen and Matthew Holford (January 2020, rev. Sept. 2020). Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue. H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885 [contents, acquisition]
Quarto Catalogue, cols. 47–8 Quarto Catalogue, p. 542 (addenda)
Summary Catalogue, Vol. 2, part 1, p. 36

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Nigel F. Palmer, Zisterzienser und ihre Bücher: die mittelalterliche Bibliotheksgeschichte von Kloster Eberbach im Rheingau (Regensburg, 1998), pp. 72–73, 146, 272, 285–86
J. Longère, Les sermons latins de Maurice de Sully, évêque de Paris (+1196): Contribution à l’histoire de la tradition manuscrite, Instrumenta Patristica et Mediaevalia (1988), 132–137
Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, 3 vols. (1966–1973) I, no. 468 (fols. 257–312: 'French (?)').

msItem.incipit: Si fornicatus est Israel Verba hec, fratres mei, Osee sunt prophete qui nomine et opere saluatorem prefigurauit
msItem.title: Sermo
msItem.note: Listed in Schneyer (IV.644) as no. 122 (this ms. listed); apparently identical with no. 17 (Schneyer IV.637), beginning part way at PL 198.1830.

msItem.rubric: Sermo episcopi mauricii in die beati uictoris
msItem.incipit: Dixit ad gedeonem angelus, Tolle carnem et panes et pone supra petram Considerandum est fratres mei, quibus uirtutibus, quibus uirtutum gradibus et quantis bonorum exercitiis beatus victor et alii martyres premium quod habent sint assecuti
msItem.explicit: in futuro pro uirtutibus remunerando dominus noster
msItem.note: Not in Schneyer.

msItem.rubric: Sermo magistri petri de petro et paulo apud sanctam genos.
msItem.incipit: Vt intinguatur pes tuus Viderunt apostoli ingressum domini in celis in die ascensionis et post ea induti uirtute ex alto predicauerunt
msItem.explicit: iudicare uiuos et mortuos et seculum per ignem amen
msItem.author: Petrus Comestor
msItem.title: Sermo
msItem.note: Schneyer IV, pp. 646 (from this ms.)

msItem.rubric: Sermo magistri petri manducatoris in die ascensionis apud sanctum uictorem
msItem.incipit: Oritur sol et occidit Si simplicitatem horum uerborum simpliciter attendamus
msItem.explicit: iudicare uiuos et mortuos et seculum per ignem amen
msItem.author: Petrus Comestor
msItem.title: Sermo
msItem.note: Schneyer IV, pp. 643 (from this ms.)

msItem.author: Maurice of Sully
msItem.title: Sermones
msItem.rubric: Sermo ad sacerdotes qui est prologus libri sequentis
msItem.incipit: Evangelistis evangelizare, predicatoribus · predicare, doctores docere
msItem.explicit: in lumine eius videbimus lumen
msItem.note: Schneyer IV.170–178, nos. 1, capitula (fol. 9v), 2–17, 19–24, 26–71. Sermo 3, de oratione dominica, is by Richard of St-Victor (R. Goy, Die Handschriftliche Uberlieferung der Werke Richards von St. Viktor im Mittelalter (2005), 2.2.1.1.2).

Texts on the creed, circulating with Sully's sermons: see J. Longère, Les sermons latins de Maurice de Sully, évêque de Paris (+1196): Contribution à l’histoire de la tradition manuscrite, Instrumenta Patristica et Mediaevalia (1988), appendix 1.

msItem.incipit: Credo in deum Quo nomine uocatur hec doctrine apostolica? Simbolum. Simbolum autem in greco et latina lingua uocatur, latina uero dicitur collocutio vel collectio
msItem.explicit: amen hebreus sermo est, latine dicitur uere, fideliter, sive fiat

msItem.incipit: Decimo die post ascensionem discipulis pre timore iudeorum
msItem.explicit: Carnis resur. Mathias. uitam eternam amen.
msItem.note: On the distribution of the articles of the creed among the apostles: pr. Longère, Les sermons latins, 395.

msItem.incipit: Quicumque uult id est si uniusquisque uult cupit uel desiderat. Quare dicitur quicumque? Ideo dicit quicumque quia deus non est acceptor personarum
msItem.explicit: sepe reperit dicens Hec est fides
msItem.note: Cf Paris, BnF Latin 14417 fols. 138ra-vb = Stegmüller, Bibl. 7706 (here without prologue); attributed with query by Stegmüller, Bibl. to Stephen Langton

msItem.title: On the punishment of sinners after death
msItem.incipit: Beati mortui qui in domino moriuntur. Et mors peccatorum pessima, quia triginta tria mala concomitantur eos. Vndecim in anima, vndecim in corpore
msItem.explicit: Unde idem Ysaias, congregabuntur in congregationem unius fascis in lacum, quasi dicat, unus super alium pro augmento pene ad se inuicem comprimendus
msItem.note: Thirteenth-century addition in a different hand. Rest of fols. 46va-b blank. Fol. 47r-v blank except for later title for the following article.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in two columns of 45–46 lines. Written above top line. Written space 200–224 120–144 . Quire 1 (fols. 1–8) pricked in outer and inner margins, otherwise pricked only in the outer margin.

decoDesc.decoNote: 2-line coloured red initials (several not filled in)

msItem.title: Commentary on Twelve Minor Prophets
msItem.incipit: Quanta sit Osee prophete difficultas, quanta et in sententiis obscuritas
msItem.explicit: quibus ille respondet Helias, qui veniet etsi credideritis iam venit, in Elia Iohannem intelligens.

msItem.note: Contemporary additions:

msItem.title: Medical recipes
msItem.incipit: Ad oculos. Bethonica . eufrasia . Polegium . equaliter

msItem.title: Verses
msItem.incipit: Omnipotens factor est kyrieleis bonus ymas
msItem.explicit: Quatenus austerum uitet minuendo dolorem
msItem.note: For a variant version (beg. 'Omnibus equat discipulum') presented as a text for the years 1191 to 1257 see Monika E. Müller, Der Bernward-Psalter im Wandel der Zeiten (2013), 44.

msItem.title: On the seven deadly sins
msItem.incipit: Species superbie in dictis, in factis, in veste, in corpore, in facie, in incessu, et aliis multis
msItem.note: Followed by distich: Quis quid ubi quando cur quomodo cum quibus et quot

msItem.incipit: Dilectio dei dilectio proximi custodia sabbati
Sunt precepta decem totam pigentia legem

msItem.title: Commentary on the Bible (Genesis - Kings)
msItem.incipit: Difficile quod durum, quod grave, quod asperum est, observatur
msItem.explicit: usque ad xii annum regni eiusdem Achaz, viii scilicet annis regnum Israel sine rege fuit.
msItem.note: Rest of fol. 138vb blank.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in two columns of 51 lines. Written space 217–220 146–150 . Written above top line. Fols. 48–90 pricked in outer and inner margins.

decoDesc.decoNote: Spaces for initials not filled in.

history.provenance: Magister Hugo, monk at the Abbey of Eberbach, inscription, c. 1200: 'Hugo magister' (fol. 48r).

msItem.incipit: Gustate et videte quam suavis est Domninus. Beatus vir qui sperat in eo. Fratres et domini omnium sanctorum sollempnitas nos ammonet
Botrus cypri dilectus meus mihi in vineis Engadi. Fratres et domini mei pia hesitatione et quadam formidine moveor quotiens egredior a me ad vos propter uestram exhortationem
Beatus vir cuius est auxilium abs te ... in loco quem posuit. Fratres et domini sicut non congruit ut parvus et humilis
msItem.explicit: nos perducere dignetur optimus magistorum dominus noster iudex noster Ihesus Christus qui cum Patre et Spiritu Sancto vivit et regnat per omnia secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: Misc. I, 172
msItem.incipit: Duobus modis diabolus humilitatem oppugnat, per iniuriam uidelicet et per reuerentiam
msItem.explicit: maiori attestatioine firmare concupiscit.

msItem.incipit: Amor ignis est. Et est amor bonus, ignis bonus ignis caritatis. Et est amor malus, ignis malus ignis cupiditatis

layoutDesc.layout: Written in two columns of 61 lines. Written space 230 162 . Written above top line.

history.provenance: Note of the visit of Berthold Von Henneberg, Archbishop of Mainz to Abbey of Eberbach on 18 June 1488 (f. 140v)

msItem.author: Peter Lombard
msItem.title: Commentary on Psalms
msItem.incipit: Cum omnes prophetas spiritus sancti revelatione constet esse locutos
msItem.explicit: Vel ueteres alia littera Posuisti
msItem.note: Breaks off incomplete at PL 191.392.

Rest of fol. 181ra and fol. 181rb blank (except for later addition 'Dum pater abbas filiam suam proponit visere
Cartam', the opening of the Goliardic poem 'De visitatione abbatis', The Latin Poems: Commonly Attributed to Walter Mapes (1841), 184); fol. 181v blank.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in two columns of 52–53 lines. Written space 200 145

history.provenance: Script of fols. 177v-181r has several Italian characteristics.
Magister Hugo, monk at the Abbey of Eberbach, inscription, c. 1200: 'Hugo magister' (fol. 142r).

msItem.author: Robert of Melun
msItem.title: Quaestiones super epistolas Pauli
msItem.incipit: Inter omnes corporeas creaturas solus homo ad imaginem Dei
msItem.explicit: sic quoque dicitur iuste retribuere.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in two columns of 59 lines. Written space 225 145 Written above top line.

msItem.incipit: Quicumque transgreditur preceptum evangelii peccat criminaliter. Preceptum evangelice est, Nolite eradicare zizania, ergo non sunt eradicanda zizania, ergo non sunt destruendi mali
msItem.note: For manuscripts see G. R. Evans, ‘The Place of Odo of Soissons’ 'Quaestiones': Problem-Solving in Mid-Twelfth Century Bible Study and Some Matters of Logic and Language’, Recherches de Théologie Ancienne et Médiévale 49 (1982), 121–140, who comments (126) 'there can be little doubt that the teaching of Odo of Soissons lies behind the collection as a whole, but it may never be possible to establish how much is owed to the work of his pupils and how much imported material has contaminated the collection as he left it'. Printed from BnF MS. Latin 3230 by J. Pitra, Analecta novissima spicilegii Solesmensis altera continuatio tom. II (Paris, 1888), here pp. 108–68, nos. 296–305 (ending at 'ergo iniuste ago' with a version of the final paragraph added in the upper margin), 306–26 (ending fol. 218vb 'Jacobo autem minori et Petro non defecit', bottom of p. 168). Followed (fol. 218vb) by four short sections, not in Pitra, beginning:
msItem.incipit: Triplex est imago, creationis, imago recreationis, imago similitudinis. Imago creationis est in qua creatus est homo
msItem.note: Followed (fol. 219rb) by contemporary or slightly later addition in a different hand beginning:
msItem.incipit: Nota alio modo accipi principium cum dicitur principium filii, alio cum dicitur principium spiritus sancti, et alio modo cum dicitur principium creaturarum

msItem.title: Quaestiones theologicae
msItem.incipit: Deus aliquem dilexit illum modo non diligit, ergo falsum est quod quemcumque diligit deus semper eum dilexit. Solutio, multis modis distinguitur hec locutio, Deus diligit
msItem.explicit: que circa hec sunt, videamus
msItem.note: Another hand adds 'sequens textus conceditur panis' and 'Quod hic deest quere in quarto folio'
msItem.incipit: (fol. 229va) uideamus conceditur panis mutatur in corpus, panis transit in corpus
msItem.explicit: ergo iuste caruit uisione dei. In futura iste uiuus
msItem.note: Fol. 229r originally blank; ex libris added 15th century and 1583; text on fol. 229v continues from fol. 228v
Fol. 234ra-vb, text continues from fol. 252v.

msItem.author: Richard of St-Victor
msItem.title: Explicatio aliquorum passuum difficilium Apostoli
msItem.note: (extract?)
msItem.incipit: Si ea que de lege ab apostolo
msItem.explicit: Nam hoc illis contulit gratia divina, non autem legis doctrina. Quisquis es ista lege nec sis lector sine lege.
msItem.note: PL 196.666–673D. Rest of fol. 236va blank., fol. 236vb blank.

msItem.title: Quaestiones theologicae
msItem.incipit: Queritur an Christus antequam Petrus ipsum negasset vellet se verum dixisse cum dixerit petro, ter me negabis
msItem.explicit: alter potest transire per purgatorium et alter non
msItem.note: fol. 252v, a marginal addition: 'quod hic deest quere in principio tercii quarti quaterni'.

msItem.title: Quaestiones theologicae
msItem.incipit: Si quis interrogatus de filio quid ipse sit, conuenienter potest responderi deus et homo
msItem.explicit: In tercia militamus, huius munimine quartam inpugnamus et quintam vitamus.

physDesc.p: Written in several sections of varying dimensions for both parchment and written surface.

decoDesc.decoNote: Sometimes 2-line red initials with simple arabesque decoration at the beginning of texts.

msItem.author: Priscian
msItem.title: Institutiones grammaticae
msItem.note: bks. i-vi (breaks off imperfect).
msItem.rubric: Institutio de arte, incipit grammatica Priscianus Cesariensis gramaticus Iuliano consuli ac Patritio.
msItem.incipit: Cum omnis eloquentiae doctrinam et omne studiorum genus sapientiae
msItem.explicit: ad nos venit errans mihi sole

layoutDesc.layout: Written in single column of 28–31 lines. Written space 220–225 140

decoDesc.decoNote: Decorated initial, fol. 257v (Pächt and Alexander i. 468, pl. XXXVIII)
Coloured initials (alternating red and green), with some occasional decoration.

revisionDesc.change: Description finalized for Polonsky German digitization project.
Description revised for Polonsky digitization project to include additional information from printed descriptions.
James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
